title: How to verify whether a law group is legit or not
question: I'm concerned about a law group in irvine california Valor Law Group is legit in debt settlement, the websight does not list any attorney name, so can't verify with bar assoc/or BBB?
answers:
The best, and simplest thing, is just to call them and ask who their attorney is (or at least their lead attorney). They may try to talk their way around a question saying they are attorney backed or give you another reason as to why they cannot answer, but don't take no for an answer. Right now there are lots of firms doing debt settlement, if this one makes you think twice, go with a different one. This is a process that will take quite a bit of time (usually a few years), so make sure you're working with a company that will still be around and is reputable.

Once you receive the attorney name, you can do a quick bar search for misconduct. However, you should probably ask some follow-up questions as to how they run their business, etc.

When evaluating a law firm, you are wise to seek to look up its attorneys' profiles with the state bar association in order to make sure that the firm's attorneys are licensed and in good standing, and to avoid attorneys with a history of disciplinary action against them.

A helpful site to locate additional information on businesses in general is the California Secretary of State's business portal (http://kepler.sos.ca.gov/cbs.aspx), which reflects that Valor Law Group is an active professional corporation formed in California a year ago in October 2009 (although please note that the Secretary's website does include a disclaimer stating that its data is not a complete or certified record of an entity). In any case, while it is positive that the Secretary's profile shows Valor Law Group to be an active corporation and does not reveal any disciplinary history, I would still recommend proceeding with caution.

As you note, there are no attorneys listed on the site, which is indeed unusual for a firm website. In addition, according to the Secretary of State's profile, Valor Law Group was only formed a year ago, so has had limited time to establish credibility. Also, it is important to take into account the rising complaints to BBB against debt settlement companies (see http://www.bbb.org/us/article/complaints-to-bbb-against-debt-settlement-companies-on-the-rise-19186).

In sum, I would recommend proceeding with caution by first seeking the identity of the firm's attorneys so you are able to to research the attorneys' qualifications and experience. If you seek this information directly from the firm, I would advise obtaining any representations from them in writing in case the firm turns out to be engaging in fraudulent practices or fraudulent advertising or the unauthorized practice of law.

Best wishes on your situation.
~ Una

You can call the Consumer Rights Division of the Attorney General's Office and ask if there are any advisories or warnings applicable to them. There is currently a lot of improper and marginal professional services being marketed for debt resolution and other financial strategies. Proceed with caution in this subject matter.
